website_summaries.verdict: The best on the market. A generous mix of features and top-notch performance makes this unit unbeatable.
pros: Gets top ratings for its reliable uniform heat distribution
cons: Rare complaints about digital display screen

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 13 months and then would not turn on
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in Nov 2106. Worked great for 13 months and then would not turn on. After researching the problem discovered that these ovens are prone to blowing the thermal fuse. Took 3 weeks to find a supplier to purchase a replacement fuse. As I am not in the USA it was not feasible to return to Breville for service. Attempted to replace the fuse myself, forget it. Why has Breville not corrected this design flaw! Never again!
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: Has fan motor problems
customer_reviews.text: After two months of light use, the fan that’s engaged when in convection mode sounds like a helicopter.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous oven - do not purchase!
customer_reviews.text: We received the oven about 7 weeks ago and this evening, while cooking dinner, the front glass exploded with glass shards flying across our kitchen. I've been unable to reach Amazon or Breville to reaffirm what others have reported, this product is a safety risk and should not be on the market. Think if someone had been looking into the oven when it exploded. Please, please, do not use this oven. If you have one, strongly consider returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Diane  A. Allison

customer_reviews.title: Good oven but convection fan quit working after six months.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality oven, great features and overall much better than the typical options out there. However my convection fan quit blowing after about six months of operation. Now it is just a toaster oven no convection function...
customer_reviews.author: Jake Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Peerless
customer_reviews.text: After three years of daily use, this has become our most important appliance. Watch the video interviews with the design team of this product to understand how and why this oven is in a class by itself. We had a few dealings directly with the company when we had a problem with moisture in the display and they were incredibly responsive, top customer service. They were also sincerely interested in understanding and correcting the problem. The replacement unit has worked like a dream these three years and has really redefined how we bake, toast and cook. I am so impressed with the design, manufacturing and service approach of this company that I would buy anything they make.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Mason

customer_reviews.title: Loved the oven until it decided it didn't love me
customer_reviews.text: Bought this oven a little less than 2 years ago. After reading the reviews decided that after paying this price for the oven needed to get the extended warranty, so did for 4 years. Loved this oven, live in FL, in summer with the AC running full blast, didn't like using the big oven because it heated up the kitchen so used this as much as possible (hate dueling appliances, the electric company loves it). Then the fan would not work, looked up the extended warranty and shipped it off to get repaired. Guess it was more than just the fan, they refunded me the purchase price of the oven. Glad I got the extended warranty, but miss my oven.
customer_reviews.author: once burned

customer_reviews.title: This oven is extremely noisy!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this Breville oven today (brand new... I think) and turned it on to prepare it for use. The convection fan in this oven is so loud and noisy that it sounds like the whole oven is about to fly apart! The fan is banging on something or has bad bearings... not sure which... Very distracting and annoying to say the least! I certainly would not recommend it to anyone! It sounds like an old B-29 with engine problems!
customer_reviews.author: Jos

customer_reviews.title: One tiny little issue.
customer_reviews.text: Great oven. Does everything as advertised. Only issue I have is the power plug. This may or may not effect you. The plug is very large and when plugged into the receptical it sticks out about 3 to 4 inches. My receptical is directly behind where I need to put this oven. I can't push the oven all the way back on my counter top because the back of the oven touches the plug. The oven does get hot (that's what ovens do). I'm afraid of kinking and or burning the power cord. I had to purchase a 1ft flush mount extension cord to solve the problem. Otherwise this is a quality unit and I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Vinny

customer_reviews.title: If kitchen is to code (GFCI outlets) beware!
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of reviewers have already discussed the dreaded E05 error, and the fact that it’s often caused by GFCI outlets (required to code here in Miami, and most other places as far as I know - kitchens and bathrooms); this was the case for us. IThere’s some confusion as to whether you need 15 or 20 amps, dedicated or not, etc etc. The fact that you need electrical knowledge to buy a toaster oven is a massive fail on Breville’s part. Going back to the model I had that lasted 6 years... pretty disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Used!
customer_reviews.text: I am very upset as this oven arrived USED! There were crumbs on the bottom and oil on the rack. I am so disappointed after paying this type of money!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Kersh

customer_reviews.title: Defective product!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Breville....BUT these are manufactured with a defective thermal fuse. Breville knows this, but does not fix the problem. We just burned out out third fuse! Breville refuses to sell the fuse separately, they want the customer to ship the oven to them, and pay to fix what they did wrong in the first place! Pretty poor customer service. We have replaced ours ourselves, but now the part seems to be unavailable on line.....of some scammer wants $30 plus shipping for a $3 part. So frustrated. Might be time for a class action suit!
customer_reviews.author: Music Mom

customer_reviews.title: Works well but runs a low temperature.
customer_reviews.text: The temperature is off by 15 degrees Farenheit. . .make sure that you test the temperature before you trust the oven.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Cooper-Wyble

customer_reviews.title: Good oven, but fan might develop noise
customer_reviews.text: Nice oven - we use it most days. Toasts perfectly, and all the other features work great, too. Only problem is that after only two months the convection fan has started to make noise. I read (now) some of the other reviews where people have noted the same problem, and that you can turn off the fan. Doesn’t seem like that should be the proper answer to the problem, though, does it?
customer_reviews.author: LAlbanese

customer_reviews.title: Very noisy
customer_reviews.text: I've had this oven for a year now and I'm not happy with it. The toast is twice as dark on the top as the bottom but the worst problem with this oven is the convection fan. It sounds like I have a diesel truck idling in the kitchen and it just gets worse with use. I realize it's a tough environment in there but they need to improve the fan. Will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Long Term Review
customer_reviews.text: This had the potential to be a great product but after 2 years the convection fan failed and that was my main purpose to buying this oven. Almost three years on and everything else still works fine but it is nearly impossible to clean properly. We use this oven every day and sure miss the convection feature.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: This one is new and works.
customer_reviews.text: Pick up from used product sent the first time. This I can say is brand new. The setup break-in was around 5 minutes and you could smell the new elements getting hot for the first time unlike the first one. Also the top gets hot as it is intended for tray warming or to keep items warm in the cooking process. No smudged finger-prints, no scratches, brand-new. So far it works fantastic. I cannot give a 5 star due to the fact of the first item received. I can say I give Amazon a 5 for the fact they stand behind every item sold and are wonderful to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Product Good Until Failure After Only One Year!
customer_reviews.text: This product, while it worked, was a great and versatile little appliace, used for toasting, roasting, baking, and reheating. It was very useful, and looked great. My only complaint was in regards to the heat distribution, as it was a little uneven, and food could quickly overcook if not monitored closely. However, what makes this a one star review is the fact that the control board went bad after less than one and a half years of low usage. One day, the toaster started "freaking out," beeping frequently while the oven light and heating elements kept turning on and off. Very dangerous! (See video of this happening.) This product should have lasted much longer than it did. Would NOT recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Noisey fan, finally stopped!
customer_reviews.text: It has worked for 2 yrs of minimal use. Only used for cooking maybe twice a month at best and the fan has stopped working. I will say it was noisey since day one and has finally given up. Another thing I have noticed is that there is a trail of grease running down the inside of glass where the lcd display is. There is no way of cleaning it and makes you wonder how grease should have gotten in there in the first place? What else is covered with grease internally, fire hazard? Anyway for the money and light use I would have expected it to have lasted way longer.
customer_reviews.author: Lp1977

customer_reviews.title: Convection feature failure
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Breville countertop convection oven...the first worked great, I used it daily for everything from steaks and roasts to cookies and rolls. I had it for 3 years. I was moving so decided to get a new one. The second worked fine for about a year, then the convection "fan" stopped working. I bought a new one. I've had this one 6 months and the convection stopped working again! I love convection cooking but live in an apartment so I can not buy a full size convection oven like I had in my house, but I will not buy another Breville!
customer_reviews.author: Christine T. Meeske

customer_reviews.title: Does not perfrom comsistantly
customer_reviews.text: This oven is a disappointment. I had a Delongi oven for 14 years and it finally passed on. I bought this one because of the Breville name. Sometimes it works at lower temperatures but when I try to cook at higher temps, it preheats and shuts off. I have tried every setting and its always the same problem. I go about my business thinking my dinner is cooking only to find it shut off and nothing is cooked. I am lucky if this oven works 3 out of 10 times. So sorry I bought this product. I do think the size is good, inside bigger than it looks. I will call manufacturer and ask questions. Maybe I got a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Broke down after a few years of use - twice...
customer_reviews.text: I love the functionality of the oven. Unfortunately, the oven doesn't last. I purchased it 2x, and both times, it broke down after a few years of use.
customer_reviews.author: SSK

customer_reviews.title: Breville replaced it after all! See my update at the end of the review!
customer_reviews.text: This oven worked great for just over a year. I was making pizza at 450 degrees and the glass door just shattered into a million pieces. Since it's been just over a year I am out of luck with the warranty which expired a week ago. I will not by one again. Update: After looking at the order more closely I realized that I had only purchased it last December and it was still under warranty. Breville replaced it free of charge so I’m hoping the last one was just defective. Time will tell but I was really happy with the customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Grunewald

customer_reviews.title: Glass blew out on first use so rating is low.
customer_reviews.text: I was heating up some left over pizza and the glass on the door blew out throwing glass everywhere. Amazon sent return slip right away. We had our last Breville oven for 6 years and it was still working good but it was looking well used, so we decided to get a new one. Disappointed and I see that this has been reported two other times in the reviews but I still think the Breville ovens are the best toaster ovens so I ordered another one. Hope this glass thing was just a fluke. (I would rate the oven I replaced the Breville 650XL with 5 Stars across the board)
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Disapointed
customer_reviews.text: The last Breville lasted six years before it went belly up. This one lasted 13 months before the convection fan stopped and the pre heat stopped working. Stay away from this turd.
customer_reviews.author: Michael West

customer_reviews.title: L❤️VE IT
customer_reviews.text: Great little oven with big results. Easy to use workhorse that performs very well. My only observation needing some improvement is the door mechanism. When closing the door, you have to be careful not to let go because there is no adjustment to prevent it from slamming shut. Not a big problem but a bit annoying. Probably an easy fix for Breville. I bought the model with the internal light and love this feature. Some people feel that paying an extra $20 for the light is not necessary, I disagree. Why open the door and change the cooking temperature when you can easily turn on the light to peek inside.
customer_reviews.author: piefan

customer_reviews.title: Ok while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: This was a good oven while it lasted, but that was the problem... after 18 months it started freaking out like the video. After this we got the E05 error. I called customer support but because it was older than 1 year the warranty doesn’t cover it anymore. To get a service person to look at it is $120+ Tax... I’m going to buy a different brand and not a “smart” toaster this time!
customer_reviews.author: Robin B.

customer_reviews.title: Glass Shattered
customer_reviews.text: The glass shattered after 3 months of normal use. Breville is going to send me a new one after I ship them the old one. Not sure I want to use it though. Luckily no one got hurt. Also, it had hot spots despite it being a convection style. Obviously, I would not recommend this brand/model.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie W.

customer_reviews.title: I love it, now I have 2
customer_reviews.text: Love this little oven. I have 2, the other is over 4 years old and still working great. I wanted a second since I removed my traditional house oven. The size is big enough for pizza and most things. However a family dinner with several entrees encouraged me to get a second. The price is very good for the great quality. I line the bottom tray with aluminum foil, probably like my grandmother would have done, lol. So it’s very easy to clean. The kids can use it and my parents are able to as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: Separate circuit?
customer_reviews.text: I never opened the box. I downloaded the owners manual and Breville "recommends a separate circuit" and to "consult an electrician". I reread the reviews and saw several mentions of fuses going out. I sent it back. Better safe than sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Potter

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product- buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: This machine broke wi a code E05 in less than 2 years. I couldn’t get customer service for 2 days then They scheduled a service phone call and didn’t call. When I finally reached them they said ONE YEAR LIMITED WARRANTY I could pay them 175 for a replacement. Rip off Terrible product and terrible company. The kitchen aid at work is older cheaper and lasted longer
customer_reviews.author: Los Angeles ENT

customer_reviews.title: I got an error code on first run
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get my new oven. I unpacked and set it up, turned it on and about 5 minutes later got a E05 code and the unit stopped working. I tried another 6 times to turn it on and every time it threw that code so I moved it to another outlet and it did it again so I am returning it. I did buy from Amazon Warehouse Deals so it may be remanufactured but I am reluctant to buy a new one for fear of the same thing happening.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Well-designed, great functionality
customer_reviews.text: Well-designed product. Wonderfully capable. We've used it: - To toast a variety of breads and muffins. The timer seems to work better than mechanical heat/pressure controls in our prior toaster ovens. (We set ours to 5 in the 1-7 scale for toast darkness.) - Heating bread - Slow cooking - Baking It has handled everything quite well. I like the magnet to pull the rack out. (Center position only.) Much better than mechanical linkages in prior toaster-ovens. Great that rack positions are indicated on the door for various functions. Looks classy, feels solid, works well. A bit expensive, but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Great oven, saves me time and money!
customer_reviews.text: What a time saver! And a electricity saver too. I no longer have to heat up my big oven just to reheat or bake a small item. Just a tip remember to adjust your temperatures and baking times down a bit i have found that this oven definitely bakes things quicker by a few minutes and i generally lower the baking temperature by 25 degrees. And the interior light is great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Really liked it, but this was the second one to fail after a year
customer_reviews.text: The oven worked perfectly. Temperature and timers seemed accurate. Had the first one for just over a year when the convection fan failed. Really liked the oven and used it almost every day, so purchased another, which failed in the same way just over a year from purchase. I would recommend it for it's function, but not for durability, especially since the failures were identical.
customer_reviews.author: Billybob

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: I love it but after 2 years it is having a problem with digital display.Not even using it light up display and make a humming noise until i tap on it then it will stop.It is still working other that problem from time to time.I hardly use the regular oven after I bought it.It cooks great and I love it as long as it keeps working.I hope it keeps working but if not I will probably buy another one.It worked perfect for around 2 years.I think it,s the best one out there.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: It gave out, a year later....
customer_reviews.text: Very practical to use... after a year the electronics in it gave out and started buzzing and clicking all of its own... I now have to make sure I unplug it to avoid a possible electrical fire. And a year and a half later it's completely dead. The electronics are dead, it won't heat up at all. It's now a $250 brick.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: VERY NOISY FAN
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived, removed for very good packing, followed instructions heat up first time smell. Convection fan made loud noise on start up and shut down like the fan blade was dragging or hitting something. Returned Toaster oven same day receiving it. Order a new same toaster oven.
customer_reviews.author: S Brown

customer_reviews.title: Too small for most standard bakeware
customer_reviews.text: I bought this oven to replace a poorly functioning gas oven. While it cooks some things well, it is too small for standard sized baking pans. It will take one 9" cake pan, but who bakes just one layer of a cake? It will not take cupcake pans, or anything bigger than a strictly 9 by 13 pan, and that includes the lip of the pan. I'm sorry I bought it - $280 is very expensive for a toaster. The instructions say it will cook a 14# turkey, but that has to be some kind of a joke - I seriously doubt if even a 5# chicken would fit in this oven.
customer_reviews.author: Reading Addict

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was recommended by America's Test Kitchen. It works like a pro. You don't need an oven unless you are cooking something big. Everything I have cooked has come out perfectly. I use it all of the time. The only small complaint is that the door handle, when open, lays on the counter. To close the door, you must reach under a hot piece of glass to slide you fingers under the handle. I have been lightly burned several times. Also wish it had a second rack. There is plenty of room for one.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Vertich

customer_reviews.title: Where is the quality control?!
customer_reviews.text: The oven came double boxed. None of the boxes were damaged. The crumb tray was bent, cracked, dented to the point where it won’t fit in the oven. I’ve tried the Breville support website that never opens. I’ve tried to submit pictures through their main website but that didn’t work either. I’ve called and waited and waited. I’ve just gave up a purchased the damn replacement crumb tray for $11. Surprisingly their website allowed me to make a purchase. Hopefully they will send an undamaged one! It really is a nice oven. My old one lasted 10 yrs. I light the added light and it’s much quieter.
customer_reviews.author: mackiam

customer_reviews.title: almost great but . . .
customer_reviews.text: I've had this oven for perhaps a week. Used it 2-3 times for baking and maybe twice for toast. Everything seemed fine until yesterday the fan started making noise. Not very loud yet but I anticipate it will get louder. Planning on returning it for another sample Update 3 days later: The fan has been feeling better for the past 2 days so I'm giving it another chance instead of going through the hassle of returning it and rebuying it. We'll have to see what happens
customer_reviews.author: road warrior

customer_reviews.title: Great oven...it tends to be a little loud while fan is on for a bit.
customer_reviews.text: Great oven to have on hand. Read all the other reviews. The Breville is top pick of all. My last one lasted 7 years. I used it everyday, several times a day. Cooking, baking, roasting, reheating...it was used until it died. I just figured it worked so well and got my monies worth...I may as well buy a new one. I did purchase the warranty because the way things are built today...well, I think I needed it.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Rider

customer_reviews.title: Buy the extended Warranty!
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through two BOV845BSS ovens in less than four years. The convection oven fan has failed on both units. The first failure the fan began making subtle noises over a short period of time and eventually stopped working. The second most recent failure was sudden. The fan stopped working (Not seized-up) but what appears to have failed is the contactor or relay that operates the fan motor. There is a hideous loud noise that can be overruled by turning off the Convection Fan Mode. I use the oven for toasting, reheating foods, baking cookies & bread and roasting vegetables. I don't broil meats as the oven is difficult to keep clean.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Much improved over older model
customer_reviews.text: Much improved over older model which actually lasted 10 years for me before the switch became unstable. Great functional setup with choices for toast, pizza, etc. and the convection oven is excellent! If you are keeping a dinner plate warm for someone, there's a function for that too.
customer_reviews.author: rxbartolo

customer_reviews.title: Best darn counter top oven!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these at a yard sale 5 years ago, it performed beautifully until it died in March 2020. I then bought a new different one on Amazon and hated it. I finally broke down and bought one here for the big bucks. I've had it just about 3 weeks now and it is even better than the one that wore out! Heats beautifully, cooks well and I rarely use my full size stove for baking. I have even made Christmas cookies in it and I'm fussy about those! Yes, it takes longer than the microwave, but the end result is much better. I highly recommend the Breville.
customer_reviews.author: stablebummom

customer_reviews.title: Great but loud
customer_reviews.text: I would hands-down give this a five star review were it not for one minor issue. This is most definitely one of the best toaster oven‘s I’ve ever owned. The number of heating options it has is incredible. I’ve never had good luck with toasting bread in in a toaster oven, but this one does an amazing job. The one issue is that as it is heating it seems to vibrate which causes there to be a shaking sound the entire time it is working. Kind of annoying, but does not seem to affect the functioning.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy P.

customer_reviews.title: Works great until it does. E05 error. Fault fuse.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this oven and it beat heating up the big oven for kids dinners and reheating pizza, but after about a year we kept getting an E05 error any time we baked for longer than 10 minutes. It's a non-resettable error, which requires contact Breville though you can unplug it and it'll go away for a time. Apparently, this is very common and has something to due with GFI outlets, which are fairly common in new apartments (the breaker is at the outlet as well as at the circuit board). So if you have that, don't get this toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett B Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 5 years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2015 and it just quit working 2020. I think 5 years is pretty good and I use it every day sometimes twice a day, reheating,baking and toasting. Even though it was a little expensive I think I got my moneys worth. The one thing that I noticed in the six months you had to press the start button several times to get it to start and at times I thought it was on walked away, wondering why it was taking so long and it was not on and had to press it again. I'm trying to decide if I should buy this again or try a different brand. Any suggestions?
customer_reviews.author: Janice Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Nice features
customer_reviews.text: This oven is very nice and the features are well engineered. My biggest problem with this oven is how the door will fly out of your hand and "slam" against the oven. This happens when the oven door is fully extended and during the "upswing" to close the door, it can easily fly loose. The spring released door is a bit too strong and if you don't have a firm hold on the handle ... it may become problematic with repeated hits.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Ramone

customer_reviews.title: Have owned two: first one died after 2 yrs, second one never distributed heat properly
customer_reviews.text: Bought my first Breville convection toaster oven in 2016 and loved it until it quit working after 2 years (pretty sure it was the thermal fuse that went bad). I ordered another one in 2018 but this time purchased a warranty with square trade. Glad I did because the second one does not distribute the heat evenly. If I roast a tray of vegetables, the veggies in the middle aren't cooked and the ones on the edges are burned to a crisp. No more Breville products for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: The fan sputtered and then stopped
customer_reviews.text: So used this as instructed From Buying it July 2017 to June 2018 when fan became a bit noisy-humming then sarted stalling now it has stopped completely so it did not function as described for over a year- it is no longer noisy as the fan wont work- Manual does not tell you how to clean or fix this. I guess will throw away-it was ok while it lasted but if you are paying over $200 for a toater oven that breaks down like this you feel crappy...
customer_reviews.author: N.Z

customer_reviews.title: QUALITY & DEPENDABILITY
customer_reviews.text: At 79 this is a very great product to use. Small enough to handle and large enough to cook anything we need. We have had this oven for three weeks and found ourselves using it every day. Today we cooked bagels in the morning and roasted a 3lb chicken at noon for lunch. Turned out perfect and very moist. Bottom line, spend a little extra and purchase this outstanding appliance. We have gone thru several during our 56 years of marriage. Quality is less expensive in long-term.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Dorothyustomer

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded from smaller mini smart oven to this
customer_reviews.text: Just like having a second oven,though smaller. Perfect for manhattan apartments. I actually prefer it to my main oven due to comparable results and avoidance of my oven heating up my kitchen. Most used features are toast,roast bake, broil, and warm. Pizza, cookies ,reheat I never use. Fyi, REHEAT slowly reheats food, WARM holds temp at 160, TOAST applies equal heat to top and bottom, BAGEL heats top more than bottom (think cut bagel, cut side up and crispy,bottom side chewy.) BAKE, I think applies equal heat allover, and ROAST applies more heat on top than bottom . The point is youll learn these easy concepts and enjoy this appliance.
customer_reviews.author: David Klein

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted three years
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until the fan quit after three years. Company wanted $129 to fix it. That's half what I paid, so made sense to just buy a new one....however, it won't be a Breville.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best oven that you can put on your countertop!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is as close to a "real" oven as you can put on your countertop (and run on 110v rather than 220). Convection works as expected, controls are relatively easy to use and performance is awesome. Make sure you can pull a full 15 amps on the circuit you're plugged into, putting it on the same plug as the coffee maker was enough to trip my breaker. My only gripe is that the time knob acts kinda funny - you can scroll up by 1-5 second increments for 30-60 seconds, then it jumps to incrementing by minute-increments. But since the rest of it was awesome, this is a minor gripe.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Mullin

customer_reviews.title: If you can afford it, but it. Works like a champ.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this oven based on all the reviews and I admit I'm very happy with it. Some of the automatic settings may not be 100% accurate for the items I cook, but with the let's face it, how many brands of bagels and pizzas are there out there; different thicknesses, refrigerated, frozen, etc. For instance, to accurately cook a frozen 12" Tombstone pizza, I use the 8" setting and the pizza comes out perfect. Just figure out what works and use that setting. Anyway, it works great, cleans up easily and I'm sure it'll last a very long while. The display and knobs are easy to use...easy to read, etc.. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Dale Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Best toaster oven yet
customer_reviews.text: Good capacity, even heating, intuitive controls, automatic shutoff, solid build ... and best of all, it toasts evenly. It's got a light inside, that sounds lame but is very handy and turns on just before the timer is done. This has taken over many of the tasks of our wall ovens.
customer_reviews.author: Bocamo

customer_reviews.title: Loved it till it broke
customer_reviews.text: Purhased this unit 18 months ago and have loved this toaster oven with convection. Fan for convection stopped working shortly after warranty period ended. Called Breville and they said they would fix it for $125. No way I am paying that amount for $199 appliance. Really disappointed that this unit failed so quickly as we really enjoyed it while it was working. Also very disappointed in Breville's response.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Ferreira

customer_reviews.title: It is a n extremely well made oven
customer_reviews.text: Best small convection oven ever made! Wanted the one with the air fryer option, but didn’t have room on the small counter area designated for a small oven. This new one replaces a 10 year old model of the same oven, that still is working. We only replaced the old one because the door brace on the right side broke & couldn't be repaired & the door would sometimes fall open. Think about that! Our 2009 model lasted 10 years. Wouldn't have any other brand, but Breville.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after only 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: Ours stopped working today, after only a little over 2 years. It turns on, but the elements won’t heat up. We’re really disappointed in Brevelle on this, especially considering how much we paid for the high end unit.
customer_reviews.author: DarkCrystal

customer_reviews.title: Excellent counter top "Oven".  We now own one for our home and one for our condo.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second of these Breville ovens we have purchased. We have one at our home which we have had for about 4 years,, and now have one in our condo. We use it all the time, as there are only two of us, and there is no reason to use the large built in oven. The convection works well and heats everything evenly. We bake potatoes, frozen breads, cordon bleu, pretty much anything that will fit. It also toasts very well. Reheating foods that you don't want to get soggy in the microwave come out well. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M Marchetti

customer_reviews.title: I waited a year and a half to write a review
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, many an appliance turns to be a dud (looking at you dead Frigidaire microwave!), so I am glad that I waited this long to write a review for this: Believe the hype. We have a full-sized oven, but we are a family of 3 and we seldom need to fire up the big one, this is more than plenty, and has never let me down. Great little oven.
customer_reviews.author: BoK

customer_reviews.title: Perfect countertop oven
customer_reviews.text: Have been using the Breville smart oven BOB845BSS for a week now and have baked a pizza, a puff pastry and a apple tart and broiled a steak. I love it. I cook for one person and don’t like using the oven in my apartment because it doesn’t work well. I have had to purchase a few smaller baking dishes but I am not complaining about that since I haven’t bought any for a long time. Looking forward to using this oven often.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beware electrical issues abound.
customer_reviews.text: Was extremely impressed with this oven for the first year while it was within the warranty period. Almost right on time once the warranty period ended it started having electrical issues, which you'll see with most Breville products if you look. The display panel flickers and the alarms sound off like its possessed by a poltergeist... needless to say this prevents it from cooking anything.
customer_reviews.author: Myndi

customer_reviews.title: Great small oven, but short life expectancy.
customer_reviews.text: We loved this oven, hands down a terrific small oven! We use it almost daily for toasting, baking and roasting. It is perfect for the needs of 2-3 people. When making my purchase I read reviews documenting how this product did not have a long-term life expectancy so I purchased the extended warranty as well. So 2 years to the month the convection fan stopped working. It hums but does not turn. I filled a claim with SquareTrade and was very disappointed they offered $21.43 on a $240 appliance. Probably will not bother using them again.
customer_reviews.author: rod2625

customer_reviews.title: My personal Mercedes....
customer_reviews.text: I won't be able to own a Mercedes, but feel I have given myself the gift of the quality of Mercedes in my kitchen. There are so many wonderful qualities of this oven! Some of my favorites: The light - it comes on when it's preheating, turns off shortly after baking begins, turns back on for the finished product. The crumb tray!!! It is easily accessible, and easily cleaned. The sound it makes - my parrot imitates (IRRITATES!) the sound of timers. This one is a welcome change. The quality and weight of the accessories....... I could go on, but you get the gist of my opinion. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Sue Parker

customer_reviews.title: I love this oven
customer_reviews.text: I love this oven. It is what I expected. With only 2 of us in the household it really saves on heating up the big oven for something small. I got rid of my regular toaster and just use this now, I absolutely love it to make pizza! The crust comes out nice and crispy and the toppings are perfect. I have only used it to make frozen pizzas..so not sure how a fresh one would be. Really like that is heats up fast....the convection feature is great too. All in all I am very satisfies with this product.
customer_reviews.author: S. L. Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Just over 2 years and still going strong
customer_reviews.text: Had this for just over 2 years and it works without a hitch. At least the one I got has been 100% reliable. It's a very versatile little oven. I mostly use it to toast things, but it's been pressed into service cooking main dishes on several occasions (like large thanksgiving gatherings) where we had more dishes to prepare than available oven space. Hasn't let us down yet. Fingers crossed, but we love this little toaster oven.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C. Cox

customer_reviews.title: So far it is great!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this toaster oven. It fits well on my counter top and works like a charm. I have used it several times and so far it is working like a charm. It is easy to clean. I bought the pizza crisper and pizza stone to go with it and everything is great. I am enjoying this addition to my kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: Sandi917

customer_reviews.title: Excellent oven, but . . .
customer_reviews.text: Excellent small oven but at 11 months the bottom two heating elements stopped working. Fortunately, with the Amazon purchase all invoices and warranties are online for return. In this case we had less than 30 days left but we got a replacement from Breville. Agree with all the positive comments and will see how long this will last. Also, be very careful and only touch handle because the exterior of the oven gets very hot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade from our 4 year old prior oven
customer_reviews.text: There are more of the automatic temperature and time settings, which is very convenient for typical use. Also a great starting point for adjustments for individual food product differences when you want to make a change - just dial up or down for either temps or times and go. Love the bottom pull-out drawer for the crumb-and-drippings catcher. Simply pull it out, wipe the liner with a damp cloth, and push back in. Larger power capability does require a little more stand-off from the wall for longer baking, but I set a small muffin fan nearby and turn it on to keep unit outside even cooler for extended cooking. Very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: W. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and well thought-out
customer_reviews.text: We looked at many small countertop ovens. This is our first and absolutely love it. We broiled, toasted and baked in it as well as reheated leftovers. The heat controls and distribution are excellent. Saves lots of time waiting for our gas oven to preheat, especially when we are in a hurray. It is very easy to clean, the bottom crumb tray is large and comes out easily. Very easy to wipe off and re-insert.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Surpasses expectations
customer_reviews.text: Totally love this oven - no other toaster oven ever purchased comes close to this one. Love that you can actually make toast using broil setting without bottom element coming on. Convection fan is so quiet you can barely hear it. Open the oven door, which feels solid, and the rack comes out, making access easy. My Cuisinart was still working but the features in my new Breville make it a very worthwhile purchase. We have affectionately nicknamed it "Brevy" and consider it as a vital part of our family. Will check out other Breville products because this one is so well designed and multi-functional.
customer_reviews.author: C. P. S.

customer_reviews.title: Convection fan quit working after only 2 1/2 years.
customer_reviews.text: Up until a week ago I would have given the Breville BOV845BSS Smart Oven Pro 5 out of 5 stars. I used it just about every day and really liked it. But having the non replaceable fan go out in just 2 1/2 years is not acceptable to me.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Wason

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically because Consumer Reports had it as the top rated toaster oven. I've never purchased a Breville before, but they are rated highly for toaster ovens. This was comparatively pricey. However, the build quality is great, the convection and heat distribution is wonderful. The controls feel solid. It comes with many preset food type settings but they are easy to modify. I would recommend this to anyone, unless you are looking for something inexpensive, in which case you should consider the Panasonic FlashXpress NB-G110P.
customer_reviews.author: Putark

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong
customer_reviews.text: This thing does an amazing job at everything I throw at it! From toast to bagels to pizza! The outside does get very hot so be careful. If I had one gripe, it's the rack only pulls out while in the center position, also I don't like that the light goes off by itself. If I want the light on, I want the light on! Kind of annoying it goes off on its on. Ok so that's two gripes but hey, I'm a public school education graduate so cut me some slack. That being said, I'd buy this again knowing those to minor annoyances.
customer_reviews.author: Homelessbear

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster oven
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I’ve had this for 4 months now. Cooks fast and great. But I made the mistake of using oven cleaner inside and it oxidized the metal and ruined it. Now I have to call Breville and hope I can do a warranty return.
customer_reviews.author: Brian T.

customer_reviews.title: Breville Smart oven
customer_reviews.text: I love this unit. I live by myself and just finished remodeling my kitchen and wanted a newer toaster oven to compliment the rest of my new appliances. Now that I have this, it almost seems like I could have saved thousands on my BIG appliances, because this thing is my go to oven/toaster oven. I like the feature when 30 seconds before the time expires, the light automatically comes on for your inspection of the contents. The dial feature for what you are planning to cook is extremely accurate in estimating the correct time and heat needed to produce the perfect food.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Thought it would have lasted longer  :(
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely loved this toaster convection oven. This is my 2nd one. The first was lost to Hurricane Irma... Now after just 3 years it is making very funky noises. Not sure if it will survive. We plan to give it some major surgery, even though it is cleaned regularly. A lot of $$ for 3 years of use :(
customer_reviews.author: Mommalaura

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you place the oven properly
customer_reviews.text: Nice features and very functional. I had been using this on top of my microwave and in that position the LCD control panel was somewhat difficult to read. Then I found a spot down lower on a table and that has greatly enhanced the readability, now that I'm looking down at the panel instead of up. It also makes the fact that the shelf slides out each time you open the door much more convenient. All in all, now that I have the oven properly placed I have no problem giving it a 5, whereas if I had written this review before having it at the proper level, I probably would have gone with a rating of 4.
customer_reviews.author: hitecpdx

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and has all the important features
customer_reviews.text: We bake some items and mainly use it for bagels, pizza, and waffles in the morning. The temp controls and reliability of this toaster oven just can't be beat. I have owned a previous Breville model and did not "love" its oven like behavior. I realized after using it for a number of years that the oven like behavior of warming up is one of its strengths and by design. If you want evenly cooked food out of a toaster oven, this is the best. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Andy H. Greenwald

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended. So nice not to have and heat up ...
customer_reviews.text: Had an older model / same with no light and no slow cook. Older model convection fan got noisy after 7 years. New one is used at least 1 or 2 times a day. comercial 1/4 pan fits perfectly. Can make Lasagna, roast, or any other for a crowd. Highly recommended. So nice not to have and heat up a full size oven here in the tropics. The light and slow cook features are distinct improvemenst. Aloha
customer_reviews.author: J.W.B.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in just under a year with little usage!!
customer_reviews.text: It stopped working after just 7 months. I barely used it. It keeps tripping the power. I definitely will never buy another Breville product.
customer_reviews.author: sebastian giangregorio

customer_reviews.title: The only small oven that actually performs like an oven.
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough about how great this small oven performs. I wouldn't waste my money on anything else, if I didn't have to. It is the only small oven that can truly imitate a large oven - pizza, rolls, precision toasting of bread or pastries. The controls are easy to operate. Lot's of options for various tasks and timing from toast to broil to reheat. I could go on and on. Spend the extra 100 bucks and get something you'll be happy with.
customer_reviews.author: Sloan Manning

customer_reviews.title: So much better than my old $30 toaster oven.
customer_reviews.text: We barely use the regular oven anymore. This works so well for reheating food, baking a few cookies, toasting taco shells, and making garlic bread without having to heat your regular oven. So many easy to figure out settings. The bottom slides out for easy cleaning so even after a year of heavy use, it still looks great. The pans that come with it are OK but we bought a little 1/8 sheet pan and tiny Silpat mat and use it all the time. It's the perfect size. It looks good on the counter and we use it daily. So glad we bought this and didn't just get another $30 toaster oven.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Knowles

customer_reviews.title: Great Oven until the glass shattered
customer_reviews.text: The oven worked great until I opened it to take the food out, and the glass just blew up. The oven is just a few month old, and only used for small heating in the morning and dinner. I would love to recommend it but I can't. We'll update this review depending on what the company offer us. UPDATE August 18: The company offered to send us a new oven, if we sent them back the old one. It took about a week. Let's hope this one's glass won't blow up, because otherwise, it's a really nice oven.
customer_reviews.author: Client d'Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Best toaster oven I could find...
customer_reviews.text: I use my toaster oven several times a day. When my Kitchen-aid died I decided to look at the current competition. I was tempted by the Kitchen-aid as a replacement since it's been a perfectly reliable unit for over 10 years...but the features of the Breville were too tempting. Yes...it's a costy little accessory...but if it has the life of my Kitchen-Aid, I'm looking at about $2 per month for ownership...and the Breville is elegant. If you are only looking for a toaster, this is overkill. If, like me, you use it for an array of cooking duties, I'm not sure there is anything better in today's market.
customer_reviews.author: Tinker-B

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: The smart oven works great and I gave it five stars, however the pans that can with it are junk. The paint is starting to peel off and they are hard to clean. I have trashed most to the cookware and purchased other cookware. I did not want to rate the toaster oven bad based on the cookware. Toaster oven 5 stars cookware 0 stars
customer_reviews.author: Gerry Clemmer

customer_reviews.title: E05 error code on very first use
customer_reviews.text: On the very first attempt to use, following the startup guide, I received an E05 error code about 15 minutes into the startup cycle. Called customer support, as manual says to do, and was told to plug into a different outlet. Same thing happened. BTW, have used a Cuisinart toaster oven for years in the 'bad' outlet. Returned to Amazon for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: The best oven I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: There are so many features to like about the Breville Smart Oven Pro. It handles a full-sized frozen pizza and toasts English muffins. It heats evenly and has excellent temperature control. I bought this because America's Test Kitchen recommended it and I have been very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill B

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on some kind of sale. My actual oven went out and I needed something till I get my new oven, might take months.. might take a year.. so I wanted something I could actually cook in and not just reheat and toast things in. So far I've cooked pizza in it (the gluten free pizzas fit perfectly), chicken, potatoes, toast, waffles (reheated them) Works great but does require so many inches of clearance. Measure your cabinets as I had to put it in a spot that I didn't plan on because my kitchen cabinets were a few inches too low (on top of the oven)
customer_reviews.author: Cher Bear

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE!  THE GLASS DOOR SHATTERED!
customer_reviews.text: I was following Breville recommended pre-programming instructions to run a pizza cycle before actually cooking something. Good thing because 15 minutes into the cycle the glass door shattered. Fortunately, no one was standing in front of the unit because some of the glass did shatter out - most went inside the unit. The entire outside of the unit was extremely hot. Amazon is refunding my account and the uesless thing is going back. (had to give 1 star because you cannot give less than one star and write a review)
customer_reviews.author: chris helman

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality and aftersales customer service, horrible BBB rating
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't work 4 days after the 2-year warranty, I've got another oven which is purchased at amazon three and a half years ago still functions well. Worse still, their customer service is very slow and useless. I filed a complaint at BBB and they completely ignored it
customer_reviews.author: Kate.T

customer_reviews.title: What an amazing little workhorse
customer_reviews.text: Wow!! What an amazing little workhorse... Pizza comes out perfect along with toast and bagels. The light is so useful for checking on things while using. Easy to use, and clean. I have had this for 2 years now, and with heavy daily use; the only thing I have had to change is the light bulb... I'm definitely thinking of getting the new one with the air fryer option. Would recommend this to any and everyone who loves to cook.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Great countertop oven
customer_reviews.text: We got this to replace our KitchenAide toaster oven -- that one still worked, but the markings on the controls wore off and you couldn't set the temp or time any closer than a wild guess. We really like this unit and it performs as expected. It has several nice features such as clear notification when the oven reaches temp, a rack that automatically slides out a bit when you open the door making it easier to unload hot food items, plenty of preset options and clear controls that are easy to operate. We've been using it for several months now and are pleased with its operation.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hennessy

customer_reviews.title: It's my favorite appliance
customer_reviews.text: I've only had my Breville Smart Oven Pro for a month but already it is my favorite appliance. I use it for everything. Toasting bread, which comes out golden brown on both sides, baking desserts as well as baking meats. The inside of the oven is coated with a teflon-like coating which is easy to clean. I especially like the oven light which comes on 30 seconds before baking or toasting is completed, so you can check for results without opening the door. I don't know when I will use my regular oven again...maybe on holidays. I also bought a liner for the oven pull-out crumb tray. Maria
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Great Tabletop Oven!
customer_reviews.text: Best table top oven for the money out there! Only disappointment was finding out only the oven front apparently is stainless steel with the rest of the cabinet being brushed steel. Looks great and performance is spectacular but brushed steel can rust so some caution is in order. Some of the so-called SS faced dishwashers are faced with brushed steel and can also rust.
customer_reviews.author: Knute000

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last 4 months.
customer_reviews.text: I paid $255 bucks of the brand name that I thought stood for quality only to start receiving an EO5 error on month 4. It’s now just another useless peice of trash clogging up a land fill. I’m going to replace it with something for half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Mowery

customer_reviews.title: Excellent toaster oven
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Breville toaster oven and it is a top performer in all categories. We use it for toasting, baking, broiling, roasting and just about everything else on the menu. Temperature control and heat distribution are both excellent. Cleaning is very good but self cleaning would be better. Other than adding a self cleaning capability, I can’t come up with anything else they could do to improve it. We very seldom have to use the full sized oven in our stove.
customer_reviews.author: Beau0225

customer_reviews.title: It's difficult to repair product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. However, con only get repairs by shipping unit to their California facility. Had a problem with a heating coil. No authorized repair service providers and they do not sell many, if not all, replacement parts.
customer_reviews.author: George Kaplan

product_meta.title: Breville BOV845BSS Smart Oven Pro 1800 W Convection Toaster Oven with Element IQ, Brushed Stainless Steel
product_meta.description: Color:Stainless SteelThe Breville BOV845BSS Smart Oven Pro with light and slow cook setting is the first oven with Element IQ that controls heating elements to suit whatever you are cooking with 10 preset functions. Slow Cook Function will automatically switch to Keep Warm for up to 2 hours and can be set at 'HI' 2 8 hours, or 'LO' for 4 10 hours. Key features comprise of a timer with auto shut off and alert, temperature conversion & frozen food functions, a color changing LCD, and a magnetic auto eject rack. Accessories included with your oven are a 12" x 12" enamel baking pan, a 12" x 12" enamel broiling rack, and a 13" non stick pizza pan. The 0.8 cubic foot interior allows for a 6 slice toast capacity, and as a guide, can accommodate most 3.5 quart Dutch oven vessels with lid, and 5 quart vessels with foil lid. Voltage 110 120 volts , Power 1800 watts. The convection setting reduces cooking time by up to 30%.
feature_bullets: Features an interior oven light to keep an eye on your cooking
10 pre set cooking functions include: Toast 6 slices, bagel, bake, roast, broil, pizza, cookies, reheat, warm, slow cook
Capacity: 6 slice toaster, 13 inches pizza. Dimensions-18.5 x 14.5 x 11 inches
Convection powered: An inbuilt fan that circulates the hot air within the oven; It speeds the cooking process by stripping away the cold air that surrounds your food
Non stick cavity coating: The walls on the inside of the oven feature a non stick coating for easy cleaning
Note: Refer user manual before use

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars3,785 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
